original_solution_mapping.L2: He gained a basil plant when one of the basil plants seeded a new plant, so he had 6 + 1 = <<6+1=7>>7 plants.
original_solution_mapping.L3: The rabbit ate both mint plants, so Gilbert had 7 - 2 = <<7-2=5>>5 herb plants when spring ended.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6209.
    Returns: the number of herb plants Gilbert had when spring ended.
    """
    # L1
    basil_planted = 3 # three basil bushes
    parsley_planted = 1 # a parsley plant
    mint_planted = 2 # two kinds of mint
    initial_plants = basil_planted + parsley_planted + mint_planted

    # L2
    gained_basil = 1 # made an extra basil plant grow
    plants_after_gain = initial_plants + gained_basil

    # L3
    mint_eaten = 2 # ate all the mint
    final_plants = plants_after_gain - mint_eaten

    # FA
    answer = final_plants
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He gained a basil plant when one of the basil plants seeded a new plant, so he had {initial_plants} + {gained_basil} = <<{initial_plants}+{gained_basil}={plants_after_gain}>>{plants_after_gain} plants.
The rabbit ate both mint plants, so Gilbert had {plants_after_gain} - {mint_eaten} = <<{plants_after_gain}-{mint_eaten}={final_plants}>>{final_plants} herb plants when spring ended.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He gained a basil plant when one of the basil plants seeded a new plant, so he had 6 + 1 = <<6+1=5>>5 plants.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The rabbit ate both mint plants, so Gilbert had 5 - 2 = <<5-2=3>>3 herb plants when spring ended.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '-' instead.
